gospel.text:
[[Mt 1,1]]The Book of the genealogy of Jesus Christ, the son of David, the son of Abraham.
[[Mt 1,2]]Abraham became the father of Isaac, Isaac the father of Jacob, Jacob the father of Judah and his brothers.
[[Mt 1,3]]Judah became the father of Perez and Zerah, whose mother was Tamar. Perez became the father of Hezron, Hezron the father of Ram,
[[Mt 1,4]]Ram the father of Amminadab. Amminadab became the father of Nahshon, Nahshon the father of Salmon,
[[Mt 1,5]]Salmon the father of Boaz, whose mother was Rahab. Boaz became the father of Obed, whose mother was Ruth. Obed became the father of Jesse,
[[Mt 1,6]]Jesse the father of David the king. David became the father of Solomon, whose mother had been the wife of Uriah.
[[Mt 1,7]]Solomon became the father of Rehoboam, Rehoboam the father of Abijah, Abijah the father of Asaph.
[[Mt 1,8]]Asaph became the father of Jehoshaphat, Jehoshaphat the father of Joram, Joram the father of Uzziah.
[[Mt 1,9]]Uzziah became the father of Jotham, Jotham the father of Ahaz, Ahaz the father of Hezekiah.
[[Mt 1,10]]Hezekiah became the father of Manasseh, Manasseh the father of Amos, Amos the father of Josiah.
[[Mt 1,11]]Josiah became the father of Jechoniah and his brothers at the time of the Babylonian exile.
[[Mt 1,12]]After the Babylonian exile, Jechoniah became the father of Shealtiel, Shealtiel the father of Zerubbabel,
[[Mt 1,13]]Zerubbabel the father of Abiud. Abiud became the father of Eliakim, Eliakim the father of Azor,
[[Mt 1,14]]Azor the father of Zadok. Zadok became the father of Achim, Achim the father of Eliud,
[[Mt 1,15]]Eliud the father of Eleazar. Eleazar became the father of Matthan, Matthan the father of Jacob,
[[Mt 1,16]]Jacob the father of Joseph, the husband of Mary. Of her was born Jesus who is called the Messiah.
[[Mt 1,17]]Thus the total number of generations from Abraham to David is fourteen generations; from David to the Babylonian exile, fourteen generations; from the Babylonian exile to the Messiah, fourteen generations.
gospel.title: Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ according to Saint Matthew

psalm.text:
[[Ps 72,1]]O God, with your judgment endow the king, 
and with your justice, the king's son;
[[Ps 72,2]]He shall govern your people with justice 
and your afflicted ones with judgment.

[[Ps 72,3]]The mountains shall yield peace for the people, 
and the hills justice.  
[[Ps 72,4a]]He shall defend the afflicted among the people,
[[Ps 72,4b]]Save the children of the poor.

[[Ps 72,7]]Justice shall flower in his days, 
and profound peace, till the moon be no more.
[[Ps 72,8]]May he rule from sea to sea, 
and from the River to the ends of the earth.

[[Ps 72,17]]May his name be blessed forever; 
As long as the sun his name shall remain. 
In him shall all the tribes of the earth be blessed; 
All the nations shall proclaim his happiness.
psalm.title: Psalms

first_reading.text:
[[Gn 49,2]]Jacob called his sons and said to them: “Assemble and listen, sons of Jacob, listen to Israel, your father.
[[Gn 49,8]]"You, Judah, shall your brothers praise --your hand on the neck of your enemies; the sons of your father shall bow down to you.
[[Gn 49,9]]Judah, like a lion's whelp, you have grown up on prey, my son. He crouches like a lion recumbent, the king of beasts--who would dare rouse him?
[[Gn 49,10]]The scepter shall never depart from Judah, or the mace from between his legs, While tribute is brought to him, and he receives the people's homage.
first_reading.title: Book of Genesis
